content: I needed that https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/70929, and figured I'd take a stab at pushing it through to stabilization. Given that it wasn't based on an RFC, I'm not quite sure what to put in a stabilization report. What are the best next steps for this?

I'll add that it seems like my crate is one of only two that use the feature, so I don't know if that's enough grounds to stabilize? I'm not sure what the requirements are: https://github.com/search?q=make_contiguous+-path%3Asrc%2Fliballoc%2F+language%3Arust&type=Code
Sorry if this isn't the right thing to do, but I was told to ask @T-libs over in the tracking issue. This feature landed back in early April — what would you want to see before it is stabilized?
@Jon Gjengset Just post a stabilization PR and I'll start an FCP on it. I think that this function is pretty uncontroversial.

@Amanieu Not sure what the next thing is for https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/74559. I'd really like to see it land in time to make the next beta. Do you think it is worthwhile to ping the relevant people here? I realize everything is also a bit thrown out-of-whack with the recent Mozilla layoffs.
@Jon Gjengset I think it's fine to ping the people who haven't filled their checkboxes.
Do you think it's best to ping them again in the PR or here instead?
they were already pinged 6 days back, so not sure a 2nd ping would have much value :grinning:

Fair enough — I guess I'm just curious whether it's that they've decided they're skeptical about approving (but haven't said anything), or whether they just haven't gotten around to looking at it yet.
i think it's the latter, generally if someone has any objections to a fcp - they will comment on it later so that the fcp gets blocked on it

It's now been two weeks since the last ping, and if I'm reading https://forge.rust-lang.org/ right, we're coming up on the merge window for the next release. Do you think another ping is warranted @DPC @Amanieu ?
I pinged them in the PR again ;)
maybe @simulacrum can help us solve this issue :grinning:
yeah pinging seems like the best idea, I can't suggest anything else. Maybe pinging in Zulip vs github could be better.

I'll try pinging one reviewer at random here too then. Hopefully this doesn't count as too much noise :sweat_smile:
@Steven Fackler
